title.value: On the (Im)Possibility of Estimating Various Notions of Differential Privacy (short paper)
title.justification: The title is taken directly from the paper.
title.quote: On the (Im)Possibility of Estimating Various Notions of Differential Privacy (short paper)

extractions.description: The paper investigates the feasibility of users estimating the level of differential privacy applied to their data in a black-box scenario, particularly focusing on local differential privacy (LDP) and R√©nyi LDP. The paper provides theoretical impossibility results and proposes a histogram-based estimator under certain conditions.

type.justification: The paper mainly provides theoretical analysis and proofs related to the estimation of differential privacy.
type.quote: We analyze to what extent final users can infer information about the level of protection of their data when the data obfuscation mechanism is a priori unknown to them (the so-called ‚Äúblack-box" scenario).

name.justification: The paper's primary focus is on different notions of differential privacy, including local differential privacy (LDP) and R√©nyi LDP.
name.quote: We delve into the investigation of two notions of local differential privacy (LDP), namely ùúÄ-LDP and R√©nyi LDP.

name.justification: The paper presents theoretical proofs and impossibility results.
name.quote: We prove that, without any assumption on the underlying distributions, it is not possible to have an algorithm able to infer the level of data protection with provable guarantees.

name.justification: The paper deals with protecting data privacy and estimating the level of privacy applied through differential privacy mechanisms.
name.quote: Differential privacy (DP) [1] is nowadays one of the best established and theoretically most solid tools to ensure data protection.
